Sometimes you don’t know what kind of light you have within you until you get the opportunity to let it shine! ✨

When you donate to Firework Foundation, you give kids the chance to get out of their comfort zones and experience the arts and take leaps (sometimes literally) into new things they might not have had access to before! 🎶🎧🏊‍♂️🤿🎨🤸🏻‍♀️

🚨Biggest Pickleball Giveaway EVER!🚨 

50+ Winners! @thedinkpickleball, in partnership with @FireworkFoundation, is giving away an entire @thepicklr Indoor Pickleball Facility to one lucky city, chosen by you, AND a LIFETIME supply of pickleball gear & more 🤯
.
Prizes: 
🏆 1x Picklr Facility for YOUR city
🏆 3x Lifetime Supply: Pickleball Gear @thepicklrshop
🏆 2x Lifetime Supply: Pickleball Apparel @stackathletics
🏆 10x Pickleball Paddle: any model
🏆 10x Case of Pickleballs: any kind
🏆 1x Join @pickleballpod as special guest
🏆 25x Lifetime Memberships from @thepicklr
.
🎁 Bonus: Receive a $20 gift card at The Picklr Shop & a 1-Month Unlimited Membership to The Picklr for completing all the steps of the giveaway. That’s right, EVERYONE wins!

.
How To Enter:
✅ Comment your city below & tag 3 friends (the cities with the most nominations move on)
✅ Follow @ThePicklr, @TheDinkPickleball & @FireworkFoundation
✅ Share this post to your story & invite others to nominate your city! 
✅ Hit the link in our bio & enter your email to complete your entry

Details: The cities with the most nominations in the comments move to the voting rounds, where you and your community will rally together to bring a premium indoor Picklr facility to the city you call home & a lifetime of pickleball gear to your closet. 

👉Everyone who participates in all the steps of the giveaways will win a FREE 1-Month Membership to The Picklr, coming to cities near you all across the country! Additional entries and contest information are available via the link in our bio.

#ConnectDinkCompete #PicklrYourCity #pickleball #katyperry

PEACE. FOR ALL CHILDREN. 

Posted @withregram • @unicef "I am deeply concerned for the wellbeing of children in Israel and the State of Palestine. 
 
With hundreds of civilians reportedly killed or injured, we are closely monitoring the situation for reports of grave rights violations committed against children. 
 
Today’s events continue the trend of spikes in violence that have wracked Israel and the State of Palestine, leaving 199 children dead and more than 2,800 injured in the last three years. 
 
UNICEF calls for the immediate cessation of hostilities, and for all parties to protect children from harm and afford them the special protection to which they are entitled, in accordance with their obligations under international humanitarian law.

More than anything, the children of Israel and the State of Palestine need a lasting political solution to the crisis, so that they can grow up in peace and free from the shadow of violence.” 

Statement by UNICEF Executive Director Catherine Russell on violence in Israel and the State of Palestine.
